2025.Materials: Metal Fabric, Wood, A Vase, Projection Mapping, tiny LCD Screen
2025.Brief: Experiments in the poetics of display technology: Esoteric explorations of screens that enable unexpected and tactile encounters with nature.
An invisible, expressive, non-tactile way for people to compose music in real time with their movements. Each person plays a different instrument, allowing harmonization and a multi user interaction.

2025.Materials: Rotary encoder, pulleys, aircraft cable, DMX-controlled LED strip, Arduino, Touchdesigner
2025.Brief: The rotary encoder captures pulley rotation allowing the position and directional movement of the LED fixture to be captured and influence the LED content.

2025.Materials: TouchDesigner, Moving Head Spotlights (12 ch DMX)
2025.Brief: A study of controlled and choreographed light using Inverse Kinematics to resolve reflections and focus; redirecting light across compound surfaces into directed beams.

2025.Materials: Sandblasting, laser cutting, acrylic, and LED panel
2025.Brief:
Creating physical distortion layers over video via sandblasting to transform digital screens into artificial windows.
By aligning and mapping video to sandblasted forms, the content can bend through texture, simulating environmental effects like rain, fog, or atmospheric depth that feel materially present rather than purely digital.

2025.Materials:
Magnets, electromagnets, fabric
3D printing on fabric, modelling
2025.Brief: Using electromagnets and magnets embedded in fabric to create a kinetic sculpture.

2025.Materials: Ethylene Glycol, LED light, 3D printed bowl, Blender, Speaker (to add vibration)
2025.Brief: Visualize time through light & sound, where water conducts the visuals over time and can receive inputs from its immediate environment. Creates a unique image & movement that depicts the temperament of a space.

2025.Team: Jeff Barbieri, Sam Chen, Kate Ducey
2025.Materials: TouchDesigner, Azure Kinect Camera, Projector, Haze Spray
2025.Brief: Objects on a table can be moved to combine colors projected both on the floor and in the air, visible as volumetric projections in haze. Objects touching, overlapping, passing over or under one another produce color mixing.
This prototype explores the capabilities of Unity's NavMesh features to inform dynamic guides for visitors in VR.

This serves as an opportunity to imagine gaze interaction beyond visuals exploreing how gaze may be better suited for types of interactions that don't require precision yet still have fun impactful results.

2025.Materials: Transparent display (OLED), 3" Acrylic Hemispheres, 3D Printed Armatures and Aircraft cable clamps, Gemini 2.5 & Kling 2.1, TouchDesigner
2025.Brief: The optical properties of the dome creates and illusion of parallax and depth when combined with purpose built content and semi transparent display.
A meditative sky watching experience that breaks up our work by bringing the environment within built spaces. It is, coincidentally, situated on a flight path.
This piece features 1,600 individually controlled LEDs stitched into custom mesh—each one programmed with pixel-mapped video content.

2025.Materials: Touchdesigner, Grasshopper, Media Pipe, Pose to point

2025.Brief: Fabricating different diffusion layers and fine tuning the effects they produce. These 3D printed lenses are constantly in motion shapeshifting and dynamically altering the visuals behind.

2025.Materials: Touchdesigner, Media Pipe, Transparent LCD Display
2025.Brief: Both users have to hold each others gaze for this digital interaction. This project explores the potential of gaze-based interactions and microgestures as a surprising control.
This piece features 1,600 individually controlled LEDs stitched into custom mesh—each one programmed with pixel-mapped video content.
This is a multiplayer, collocated approach to mixed reality baseball. Playing with room meshes and scales in this proof of concept.

This is a multiplayer, collocated presentation wherein we can move between MR and AR with a "presenter" leading the audience through the experience - letting them focus on markups and information absorbption rather than controls.
Initial tests of 3D prininting on fabric to alter and fine tune dimensionality, form and movement.
A simple proof of concept on using AR geospatial markers in service of large, site-specific gestures

2025.Team: Sam Chen, Aaron Parsekian, Tanvi Mishra
2025.Brief: Fiber optics embedded in concrete lit up and animated
Picking up on the colors in clothing and synthesising it into ambient music

2025.Team: Tanvi Mishra, Andrew Cotter, Jeff Barbieri
2025.Brief: This is a multi-user demo with two roles that are collaboratively creating.  The "alchemist" has a mobile device from which they can control the rules of the interactions.  The "artists" in Meta Quest Headsets can create strokes informed by the alchemist.

2024.Brief: Using dichroic screen, fabricated enclosures and rotating servo motors to create a sun dappled look
Using 3D printing, fabricated enclosures and rotating servo motors to create a pixelated array
Using prisms, fabricated enclosures and rotating servo motors to bend light into different colors
Using prisms, fabricated enclosures and rotating servo motors to bend light into different colors
Hand movements sweeping across can transform the wallpaper unexpected into living interactive content
Transforming cork into a lamp shade to breathe new life into the material

2024.Team: Jeff Barbieri, Philip Mcausland, Aaron Parsekian
